question.question-text: Paragraph A contains 3 errors in grammar and sentence structure. Click on the errors in this paragraph.

error-list.explain-text: This sentence has two main clauses the reading passage presents and the listening passage presents, which are connected with a comma. A comma cannot be used to connect two main clauses. To correct this error, you can either change the comma to a semi-colon or add a coordinate conjunction such as and.
In this sentence, the article a is accompanied by the verb discuss. An article should be accompanied by a noun. To correct this error, you can change discuss to discussion.
In this sentence, the countable singular noun decision requires an article. To correct this error, you can change final decision to a final decision or the final decision.

question.question-text: Paragraph B contains 7 errors in grammar and sentence structure. Click on the errors in this paragraph.

error-list.explain-text: In this sentence, the helping verb was is followed by the base form face. In this case, a form of the verb be should be followed by a present participle. To correct this error, you can change face to facing.
In this sentence, the adverb seriously is describing the noun tardiness. An adjective should describe a noun. To correct this error, you can change seriously to serious.

This one-clause sentence has a subject problem and a verb was introduced by the subordinate clause connector Because. A one-clause sentence cannot be introduced by a subordinate clause connector. To correct this error, you can change the period following serious to a comma and remove the capitalization on The in the following sentence.
In this sentence, the first verb asked is in the past tense, and the second verb do is in the present tense. To correct this error, you can change do to did.
In this sentence, the plural verb were does not agree with the singular subject One. To correct this error, you can change were to was.
In this sentence, the singular pronoun he refers to the plural noun employees. To correct this error, you can change he to they.
In this sentence, the word due is part of the expression due to. To correct this error, you can change due tardiness to due to tardiness.

question.question-text: Paragraph C contains 6 errors in grammar and sentence structure. Click on the errors in this paragraph.

error-list.explain-text: In this sentence, the singular noun plan does not agree with the plural quantifier two. To correct this error, you can change plan to plans.
In this sentence, the indefinite article a is used with the definite idea first possible solution. To correct this error, you can change a to the.

In this sentence, the subordinate connector because is followed by a subject but is missing a verb. A subordinate clause connector should be followed by a subject and a verb. To correct this error, you can change this not to this was not.

In this sentence, the modal helping verb would is followed by the past participle lost. A modal helping verb should be followed by the base form of the verb. To correct this error, you can change lost to lose.
In this sentence, the adverb valuably is used to describe the noun work. An adjective should be used to describe a noun. To correct this error, you can change valuably to valuable.
In this sentence, both is used with or. The correct paired conjunction is both…and. To correct this error, you can change or to and.
